column5: When it's time to shoot....SHOOT!!!!!

The Good, The Bad and the Ugly is the BEST western ever made. For a Few Dollars More and A Fistful of Dollars (which is almost a shot for shot remake of the Japanese film "Yojimbo" which is even better though if you don't mind subtitles) are great too, as is Once Upon a Time in the West. The Magnificent Seven (remake of The Seven Samurai which is another great movie) is another good one. Shane, Unforgiven and basically anything with the Duke.
Geronimo

"I've been looking for you for 8 months. Whenever I should have had a gun in my right hand, I thought of you. Now I find you in exactly the position that suits me. I had lots of time to learn to shoot with my left.  ""When you have to shoot, shoot. Don't talk" Tuco shoots one armed man ... I can quote the whole movie if ya want , not something my wife is proud of . love that movie I have watched it at least 1000 times the music is so good when I watch it now its with my guitar on my lap and my multi effects on, For those who care (maybe JOE )Punk rock band the Ramones played this song as the opening for their live album Loco Live as well as in concerts . great music , A different instrument was used for each: flute for Blondie, ocarina for Angel Eyes and human voices for Tuco.
Great stuff!!  I love that scene!

#1 Anything with Rooster Cogburn in it (You can't lock up a man's whiskey!) #2 Blazing Saddles - I know but Harvey Korman (where's my ducky) and Madeline Khan (face it boys I'm Tired) #3 Tombstone - Absolute amazing performace by Val Kilmer (I'll be your Huckleberry)  and yes Cat Ballou

"The Sheriffs a BONG!!!"  I love Blazing Saddles, Harvey Korman is awesome in it!  If you like Robert Duvall watch the Mini-series Lonesome Dove, its one of my favourites, the books even better!  Tombstone is a great modern western!
What about the HBO series Deadwood? One of the best shows I've ever watched, sadly only 3 seasons to enjoy!

Can't believe Silverado(1985) has not been mentioned. Great cast with Kevin Kline,Scott Glenn, Danny Glover,Kevin Costner,Brian Dennehey, John Cleese, Jeff Goldblum, Roseanne Arquette,Linda Hunt. The best western by far from a time when Westerns were poison in Hollywood.  [Paden has gotten his horse back and they're "kissing" each other] Cavalry Sgt.: How do I know this is your horse? Paden: Can't you see this horse loves me? Cavalry Sgt.: I had a gal do that to me. It didn't make her my wife.
Frankie you are allways wellcome in my house , all the beer you can drink , fishing stories up the whahoo and none stop Sergio Leone , Capt
LOL, now that's a great offer!  That line needs to be played out on this board more often than not...let's change it to.........  WHEN YOU HAVE TO FISH, FISH!!!! DON'T TALK!!!
Just recently watched a few westerns.  True grit and 3:10 to yuma.  Any other recommendations.
I perfer all the oldies. Cant go wrong with anything starring Clint Eastwood.

Rio Bravo High Plains Drifter The Unforgiven The Shootist Tombstone The Outlaw Jose Wales The Magnificent Seven The Wild Bunch Fistful of Dollars The good, the Bad and the Ugly  These are some of what i consider, the best western movies ever made.
Both good ones, LD. Try "Bad day at Black Rock".
Thanks guys kinda getting hooked on them now.
Anything with the Duke  Fort Apache Horse Soldiers

I used to really enjoy the ones with Terence Hill in them, My Name is Nobody, Trinity is Still my Name and They Call me Trinity.  He was really great with Bud Spencer.  Might have to look them up myself now and rewatch.
Stage Coach Once Upon a Time in the West
Pale Rider---Clint  The Cowboys--Johnny  Dances With Wolves--Kev

So many to chose from. You could just pick an actor or style or a decade and have lots of fun.  Just use proper names of movies titles from the 50s: Hondo Shane Sitting Bull Taza, Son of Cochise Calamity Jane etc

Big fan of westerns;  Red River dances with wolves The man who shot liberty valance Glory Outlaw josey wales Winchester 73 the alamo 3;10 to yuma (the original) Jeremiah johnson she wore a yellow ribbon shenandoah they died with there boots on Cat ballou  and a whole lot more
clint eastwood, nuff said
All the Clint Eastwood movies, and Shane. Best western ever!
BLAZING SADDLES
X2 ....also Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid - Redford, Newman The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean - Newman
You got to watch The Proposition its on Netflix currently. Its an Australian Western
Mclintock with the Duke!  A real rib splitter.  Also, though not a western, Hatari with the Duke, set in Africa.  Michael
Magnificent Seven!!!
Some classics there
Two Mules for sister Sara.   If that's the one where Clint has to shoot the Dynamite on the train bridge with the rifle.  Great scene.
X 2  Love that movie
Fistful of Dollars!!!!  Aim for the heart Ramon!!!!!
Cat Ballou x 2 Lee Marvin and his horse slay me! Also, Jane aint hard on the eyes in that movie. HH

The good the bad and the ugly , "HEY BLONDIE" "Tuco"  "Angel Eyes" and the music just so great , you cant go wrong with any of the  Sergio Leone films . Also the treasure of sierra madre "badges? we aint got no badges! I dont have to show you any stinking badges , John Huston he knew how to make a western , And dont leave out sam peckinpah
The horsesname was Amigo!
